STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 28, 2024
Felisha M Glutsch
Ennis Center for Children- Flint
129 E 3rd ST.
Flint, MI, 48502-1728
Re: License #: CB250201108
Dear Ms. Glutsch:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
2/6/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
FOM POLICY 722-08D TREATMENT PLANS – AGREEMENT AND SIGNATURES
Once completed and approved the caseworker must obtain
signatures from the following individuals, as applicable:
Caseworker, Supervisor, second line supervisor, when siblings
in care are place apart, parents who are a member of a
participating household. Youth ages 14 and older. Foster
parents, relative caregivers, and unrelated court -ordered
caregivers. Parents/legal guardians, youth, and caregivers
must check yes or no for the following when signing the
treatment plan: I have participated in the Development of the
Case service plan and Parent Agency Treatment Plan.
6 open foster care files and 17 service plans were reviewed, (4 of 17 PATPs) were
either missing PATP signatures, signatures not obtained within 30 days of the
updated service plans and yes or no were not checked indicating participation of
the updated service plan.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
02/16/2023 Renewal, CAP Approved 02/21/2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
No technical assistance was required during this licensing period.
2

V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was requested or required during this licensing period.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. SE#2023C0000467 was generated on 3/24/23 for behavior management.
The caregiver was found in noncompliance with rule 400.9404 (1). The caregiver
license was revoked.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency Renewal inspection was completed on 2/16/23 and the CAP was
approved on 2/21/23. The agency was found in noncompliance with policy FOM
722-08D. This is a repeat violation during this licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was discussed with the agency director
onsite 1/31/24. The director reported the last corrective action plan brought
attention to areas that needed oversight and improvement. She reported the prior
CAP was not implemented and followed by staff, supervisors, or the director due
to a high turnover in the past year with foster care workers, supervisors and a
director leaving abruptly. Items were not tracked consistently causing late and
inaccurate service plans. She reported the agency is in a much better position
now because supervisors follow -up on assigned tasks from monthly supervision
focusing on due dates. A CAP refresher training is conducted monthly to remind
staff of the CAP requirements with the intentions to improve noncompliance’s and
to focus on job responsibilities and requirements.
Financial Overview
The agency annual audit by an independent certified public accountant dated
9/30/22 and their annual budget were reviewed. No concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed were very positive about working at the agency. At this time,
they would not change anything about the agency. Staff reported feeling
supported by their supervisors and coworkers.
3

Youth Interviews
The youth interviews with the Analyst were positive and indicated appropriate
support and services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The building has adequate space to provide the required services and the record
maintenance were stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety alerts/concerns during this licensing period.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
2/23/2024
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
02/28/2024
Samanatha Way Date
Area Manager
4
